author: Odeinoichus
title: Rainbows and Magic and Costumes Oh My!
review:
Set #71008 Unicorn Girl: Another excellent animal costume minifigure is created with Series 13, and it looks very impressive considering it has such minimal print details.

Unicorn Girl has a very minimalistic print with a few stars on her front torso near the neckline, some printing on her toes for the hooves and that's pretty much it. Her facial expression is a cute one with a fun looking smile and some great freckles on her cheeks. She includes a new tail piece with a horse tail to attach on the legs and a large head piece sculpted in the guise of a horse, with a slot to attach a horn.

Overall this minifigure is a bit less impressive when it comes to the parts, for re-use purposes you are rather limited, however it is an awesome looking costumed minifig and only the second one to be a female character. Unicorn Girl looks great and will be definitely worth tracking down if you missed out on it the first time. Strongly recommended.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Missing an accessory
review:
Opening;

The unicorn girl is a good figure but feels as if it is missing an accessory .

The Minifigure-

head attachment is quite nicely moulded and has some subtle prints , the horn is just the unikitty horn in white , the head showcases a happy expression , the torso is plain but doesn't require any more prints , the hip attachment is a very nice tail with lavender printing and the legs are simple but affective .

The stand -

 The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion-

this is a good figure but feels like it is missing an accessory I don't know what but it just feels like it is missing one but I still recommend it .

author: sideswinger
title: ADORABLE!
review:
I feel like most LEGO CMF fans have very different opinions on Series 13. Some love it, including myself, while others deeply hate it. But I think all fans can agree that the Unicorn Girl, the third character in the set, is amongst the best. This set of 16 released back in 2015, where it had a retail price of 4 dollars.

Atop this minifigure is two connecting pieces: a horn, and a mask. The unicorn horn, which was new to the figure in white, pegs onto the top via a pole connection, and that horn is made from a rubber material. The mask piece looks splendid and adorable; I love the eyes. I will say that I wish the horn was coloured in perhaps a light purple to contrast the plain white, but I can dig it. This whole figure has a cute aesthetic, but that's mostly thanks to her adorable head piece, which has a small smile.

The torso has minimal printing, but I'm not complaining. I appreciate the small multicoloured stars below the head, which add to the overall aesthetic. She doesn't have any back printing, however her amazing tail more than makes up for it. It was a brand-new mould made for this character that's entirely caste in white rubber. Purple printing is applied to the back, as are some moulded streaks.

She doesn't have any accessories, but she doesn't need one, considering two moulds were designed especially for her. She's adorable, fantastic, and a solid 5 out of 5 points, as well as one of my favourites in the series!
